alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Inland Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 08 at 8:00PM PDT until September 09 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire and San Diego County Valleys. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moisture associated with Tropical Storm Kay will bring periods of rain and thunderstorms, heavy at times, in the valleys. The heaviest rain will likely be Friday night. Total rainfall of 1 to 3 inches will occur, with highest amounts near the foothills of the mountains. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Inland Valleys
